N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 435.5 - Length of service

State Regulations
(a) Respite care and services for families
may be provided as needed which may include periods of less than 24 hours. Respite care and services for foster families and foster children must be
provided for periods of at least 24 hours. (b) Respite care and services for foster
families may be provided for up to a maximum of 30 consecutive days at a time, per child. (c) Respite care and
services for families may be provided for up to a maximum of seven weeks per
child, per year, except that where a parent is participating in a substance use
disorder treatment program or there are extraordinary circumstances that
warrant an additional respite stay as approved by the social services
district. (d) Repealed
(e) Repealed
